title: Upgrade from 1080ti to 3080ti
body:
Hi, 

Running training in SAEHD (with the latest RTX3000 build) on first try it works fine starts training, then hangs, 2nd try I get the error below:

RTX3080TI
64GB RAM
3900x
The error:

*Describe, in some detail, what you are trying to do and what the output is that you expect from the program.*

`Starting. Press "Enter" to stop training and save model.
Error: Could not synchronize CUDA stream: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_FAILED: unspecified launch failure
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1375, in _do_call
    return fn(*args)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1360, in _run_fn
    target_list, run_metadata)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1453, in _call_tf_sessionrun
    run_metadata)
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.InternalError: Could not synchronize CUDA stream: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_FAILED: unspecified launch failure


During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\Trainer.py", line 129, in trainerThread
    iter, iter_time = model.train_one_iter()
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\DeepFaceLab\models\ModelBase.py", line 474, in train_one_iter
    losses = self.onTrainOneIter()
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\DeepFaceLab\models\Model_SAEHD\Model.py", line 774, in onTrainOneIter
    src_loss, dst_loss = self.src_dst_train (warped_src, target_src, target_srcm, target_srcm_em, warped_dst, target_dst, target_dstm, target_dstm_em)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\DeepFaceLab\models\Model_SAEHD\Model.py", line 584, in src_dst_train
    self.target_dstm_em:target_dstm_em,
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 968, in run
    run_metadata_ptr)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1191, in _run
    feed_dict_tensor, options, run_metadata)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1369, in _do_run
    run_metadata)
  File "E:\D3\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA_RTX3000_series\_internal\python-3.6.8\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\client\session.py", line 1394, in _do_call
    raise type(e)(node_def, op, message)  # pylint: disable=no-value-for-parameter
tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.InternalError: Could not synchronize CUDA stream: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_FAILED: unspecified launch failure
Done.
Press any key to continue . . .
`

I reinstalled windows, installed Nvidias latest drivers for the card, ran the whole thing again. At first it stops randomly when running. Then running again I get the error

![zGmbPqTh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46832119/147686997-b93f3a83-f094-4607-90df-e734e9f539b7.jpg)

![00s9CRJh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46832119/147686999-7f5f5b0a-b936-48e8-9e84-61459ae48380.jpg)

![Screenshot 2021-12-29 at 17 25 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46832119/147688056-a597ed5b-0547-4030-bbd8-cac571960cf1.png)
.
